citeulike_paper.title: Flink: Semantic Web technology for the extraction and analysis of social networks
citeulike_paper.abstract: We present the Flink system for the extraction, aggregation and visualization of online social networks. Flink employs semantic technology for reasoning with personal information extracted from a number of electronic information sources including web pages, emails, publication archives and FOAF profiles. The acquired knowledge is used for the purposes of social network analysis and for generating a web-based presentation of the community. We demonstrate our novel method to social science based on electronic data using the example of the Semantic Web research community.

source.title: Web Semantics: Science, Services and Agents on the World Wide Web, Vol. 3, No. 2-3. (October 2005), doi:10.1016/j.websem.2005.05.006ￂﾠ Key: citeulike:11492883

scholarly_article.title: Flink: Semantic Web technology for the extraction and analysis of social networks
